column4: shouldn't the Alternate install cd should fit in a 650MB cdrom disk? its like 696.5MB ?
650MB disks tend to allow for a little extra .. so that might fit but just about
i guess not..i have a cd-rw
i'm guessing you have tried to fit it on then -- you probably need a 700MiB disk then
yes i tried burning em, didnt noticed the size until it got ejected.  and I didnt know there are cdroms that are over 650MB, i thought 650MB is max
the standard capacities for CD-Roms are 650MiB and 700MiB .. there are other non-standard ones which accomodate more or less
but, isnt runlevel2 the default on ubuntu?
i think 2-5 level is default, so going to level 1 might make a difference and then back
errm, i'm quite certain that there are differences in runlevels 2-5 .. it's better to go to runlevel2 after 1
are you sure it's not CIFS (like samba) thats not sharing the printer there?
the LPD services is run on the xp
i just need to telnet to it or something to check the queue if it is getting the print jobs
if you were to be strict .. LPD is a unix thing not windows .. so if you said LPD on windows, i'd be inclined to think you were running it under cygwin/uwin
they have an equivalent LPD services running on the windows xp
well, i think you mean "Windows File and Printing Services"  .. so http://www.faqs.org/docs/Linux-mini/Debian-and-Windows-Shared-Printing.html
actually I dont know how to test if one is running (LPD) on an Linux box..just do an lpstat?
that could be it, File and print services
err yea, that link has a section i think to troubleshooting the windows print services
